channel.title: Journals on Renata's learning journals
channel.description: Recent content in Journals on Renata's learning journals

item.title: Encouragement design
item.description: Let’s learn about encouragement design (the idea of randomizing an encouragement to take up a treatment rather than the treatment itself) and the advantages and disadvantages of developing one.

item.title: CLT & Sampling distributions
item.description: Let’s learn how the central limit theorem relates to the idea of sampling distribution and how we can use simulations in R to model the sampling distributions we need in order to make inferences about a population.

item.title: Normal (Gaussian) distributions
item.description: Let’s learn and explore the properties of distributions, with a focus on the Normal (“Gaussian”) distribution, and use R to create a function to code one.

item.title: Descriptive Statistics
item.description: Let’s learn how to make sense of the data using R: the mean,the median, the mode and the standard deviation.

item.title: Understanding Variables
item.description: Let’s learn how to interpret variable relationships (whether they are independent, dependent and confounding).

item.title: Understanding causation
item.description: Let’s learn the proper ways to interpret causation and how to avoid the correlation fallacy.
